intro: Alepidea inflexa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Alepidea inflexa is known for its fragrant blooms, which appear in late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
